docs.lead_paragraph: After years of trying to keep marijuana out of schools, educators across the country are grappling with how to administer cannabis to students with prescriptions for it.

headline.main: Schools Mull Medical Marijuana Policies Over Student Use
headline.print_headline: Schools Mull Medical Marijuana Policies Over Student Use

docs.snippet: After years of trying to keep marijuana out of schools, educators across the country are grappling with how to administer cannabis to students with prescriptions for it.

docs.lead_paragraph: The treatment was at one point the top experimental therapy recommended by the World Health Organization for testing during the Ebola outbreak in West Africa.

headline.main: Ebola Treatment Using Plasma From Survivors Is Not Effective, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Survivors’ Plasma Is Not Effective Ebola Treatment, Study Says

docs.abstract: Study in New England Journal of Medicine finds experimental treatment for Ebola patients in Guinea involving transfusion of blood plasma containing disease's antibodies was ineffective; paper in same issue asserts doctors had some success with alternative malaria treatment among Ebola patients in Liberia; experts suggest both approaches would benefit from more testing.
docs.snippet: The treatment was at one point the top experimental therapy recommended by the World Health Organization for testing during the Ebola outbreak in West Africa.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Gaza Strip's struggling healthcare system will get some much needed help in 2016 after the first new hospital in a decade opened its doors in the territory last month and as two more foreign-funded clinics are set to launch this year.

headline.main: Gaza Strip Gets First New Hospital in a Decade, Two More Due This Year
headline.print_headline: Gaza Strip Gets First New Hospital in a Decade, Two More Due This Year

docs.snippet: The Gaza Strip's struggling healthcare system will get some much needed help in 2016 after the first new hospital in a decade opened its doors in the territory last month and as two more foreign-funded clinics are set to launch this year.

docs.lead_paragraph: A survey of research presses the case that infections, even in the womb, are linked to mental illnesses like schizophrenia.
docs.abstract: Meghan O’Rourke reviews book Infectious Madness: The Surprising Science of How We 'Catch' Mental Illness by Harriet A Washington.
docs.snippet: A survey of research presses the case that infections, even in the womb, are linked to mental illnesses like schizophrenia.

keywords.value: Infectious Madness: The Surprising Science of How We 'Catch' Mental Illness (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

docs.lead_paragraph: Three books report on the microscopic creatures that live in our bodies, and their influence on how we function.

headline.main: ‘The Diet Myth,’ ‘The Good Gut’ and ‘The Hidden Half of Nature’

docs.abstract: Sonia Shah reviews books The Diet Myth: Why the Secret to Health and Weight Loss Is Already in Your Gut by Tim Spector, The Good Gut: Taking Control of Your Weight, Your Mood, and Your Long-Term Health by Justin and Erica Sonnenburg and The Hidden Half of Nature: The Microbial Roots of Life and Health by David R Montgomery and Anne Bikle.
docs.snippet: Three books report on the microscopic creatures that live in our bodies, and their influence on how we function.
